content: chunky stripe scarf adult & child versions adult version child version skill level beginner/easy size approx 6 wide x 52 long for adult version approx 4 wide x 44 long for child version materials 1 chunky-weight or worsted weight yarn about 150 yds each of 3 different colors note 3 colors of handspun heavy worsted/chunky wool were used for the gray version child version shown in lion brand yarns chunky usa adult tan/brown/green version created later in ww caron simply soft size j/10 6 mm crochet hook or size needed to achieve gauge tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge 10 double_crochet = 4 with chunky yarn on size j/10 6 mm hook terms/abbreviations back loop only blo beginning beg chain chain double crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet hook hk repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet skip skip slip_stitch slip_stitch stitch st pattern notes stitch sequence is the same for both adult and child scarves -- the child size scarf is shorter and narrower you will be working one row in each of 3 different colors so carry unused yarns loosely up side of work do not cut unused yarn until instructed to do so adult scarf foundation row chain 129 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and in each chain across 125 double_crochet at end of foundation row drop color a do not cut it but carry colors loosely up side of work and pick up color b chain 1 turn row 1 working in back loop only single_crochet in ea double_crochet across row at end of row drop color b do not cut but carry loosely up side of work pick up color c chain 1 turn row 2 working in blo single_crochet in ea single_crochet across row at end of row drop color c pick up color a chain 3 turn row 3 working in blo double_crochet in ea single_crochet across row at end of row drop color a pick up color b chain 1 turn repeat row 1-3 changing color each row while carrying unused color up side of work until you have a total of 13 row including the foundation row drop color a and pick up color b chain 1 turn at this point you may cut colors a and c leaving a 6 length for weaving in 2 working in both loops around entire edge of scarf single_crochet in ea st around working 1 single_crochet in each row at scarf ends working 3 single_crochet in ea corner and encasing the loosely- carried strands inside the single_crochet stitches to hide them slip st to first single_crochet fasten_off and weave in ends give the scarf a pull at both ends to straighten stitches child scarf same instructions as for adult scarf above but with 100 double_crochet and only 7 row total as follows foundation row with size j hook chain 104 double_crochet in 4th st from hook and ea chain across 100 double_crochet repeat row 1-3 twice to end up with 7 row total including the foundation
